title: Using `nybem`
text: install nybem package, install GitHub using remotes package:

title: Using `nybem`
code: library(nybem) ##  ## Attaching package: 'nybem' ## The following object is masked from 'package:base': ##  ##     ifelse library(raster) ## Warning: package 'raster' was built under R version 4.1.3 ## Loading required package: sp ## Warning: package 'sp' was built under R version 4.1.3

title: Using `nybem`
text: nybem package contains models created ecological modeling section NTBEM feasibility study. Notice nybem::nybem_submodels list contains pair data frames submodel study. pair dataframes named submodel represents (.e., NYBEM.fresh.tid = Freshwater Tidal Zone habitat model). first data frame contains habitat variables matching suitability index values, second data frame (*_labels) contains labels used plotting.
code: # Load the model data nybem_submodels <- nybem::nybem_submodels  # View the available submodels names(nybem_submodels) ##  [1] "NYBEM.fresh.tid"                "NYBEM.fresh.tid_labels"         ##  [3] "NYBEM.est.int"                  "NYBEM.est.int_labels"           ##  [5] "NYBEM.est.sub.hard"             "NYBEM.est.sub.hard_labels"      ##  [7] "NYBEM.est.sub.soft.sav"         "NYBEM.est.sub.soft.sav_labels"  ##  [9] "NYBEM.est.sub.soft.clam"        "NYBEM.est.sub.soft.clam_labels" ## [11] "NYBEM.mar.int"                  "NYBEM.mar.int_labels"           ## [13] "NYBEM.mar.sub"                  "NYBEM.mar.sub_labels"           ## [15] "NYBEM.mar.deep"                 "NYBEM.mar.deep_labels"

what: View the Suitability Index data frame
title: Using `nybem`
code: # View the Freshwater Tidal model # View table of habitat variables and their suitability index values  nybem_submodels$NYBEM.fresh.tid ##   salinity.per salinity.SIV veg.cover.per veg.cover.SIV deposition ## 1            0            0            50           0.0          0 ## 2           20            1            57           0.5          1 ## 3          100            1           100           1.0         NA ##   deposition.SIV ## 1              1 ## 2              0 ## 3             NA

what: View the Suitability Index model labels
title: Using `nybem`
code: nybem_submodels$NYBEM.fresh.tid_labels ##               model                                label   variable ## 1 Freshwater, Tidal Salinity duration (% time > 0.5 psu)   salinity ## 2 Freshwater, Tidal                 Vegetation Cover (%)  veg.cover ## 3 Freshwater, Tidal                       Relative Depth deposition

title: Using `nybem`
code: # Single numeric site observations salinity   <- 40 veg.cover  <- 100 deposition <- 0 obs_1 <- list(salinity, veg.cover, deposition) obs_1 ## [[1]] ## [1] 40 ##  ## [[2]] ## [1] 100 ##  ## [[3]] ## [1] 0 # Raster site observations salinity_ras   <- raster::raster(ncol = 2, nrow = 2, vals = rep_len(40, 4)) veg.cover_ras  <- raster::raster(ncol = 2, nrow = 2, vals = rep_len(100, 4)) deposition_ras <- raster::raster(ncol = 2, nrow = 2, vals = rep_len(0, 4))  obs_2 <- list(salinity_ras, veg.cover_ras, deposition_ras) obs_2 ## [[1]] ## class      : RasterLayer  ## dimensions : 2, 2, 4  (nrow, ncol, ncell) ## resolution : 180, 90  (x, y) ## extent     : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) ## crs        : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs  ## source     : memory ## names      : layer  ## values     : 40, 40  (min, max) ##  ##  ## [[2]] ## class      : RasterLayer  ## dimensions : 2, 2, 4  (nrow, ncol, ncell) ## resolution : 180, 90  (x, y) ## extent     : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) ## crs        : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs  ## source     : memory ## names      : layer  ## values     : 100, 100  (min, max) ##  ##  ## [[3]] ## class      : RasterLayer  ## dimensions : 2, 2, 4  (nrow, ncol, ncell) ## resolution : 180, 90  (x, y) ## extent     : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) ## crs        : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs  ## source     : memory ## names      : layer  ## values     : 0, 0  (min, max)

title: Using `nybem`
code: # Suitability Index value for single numeric site observations siv_fresh.tid_obs_1 <- nybem::SIcalc(SI = nybem_submodels$NYBEM.fresh.tid,                                  input_proj = obs_1) siv_fresh.tid_obs_1 ## [[1]] ## [1] 1 ##  ## [[2]] ## [1] 1 ##  ## [[3]] ## [1] 1 # Suitability Index value for raster site observations siv_fresh.tid_obs_2 <- nybem::SIcalc(SI = nybem_submodels$NYBEM.fresh.tid,                                  input_proj = obs_2) siv_fresh.tid_obs_2 ## [[1]] ## class      : RasterLayer  ## dimensions : 2, 2, 4  (nrow, ncol, ncell) ## resolution : 180, 90  (x, y) ## extent     : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) ## crs        : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs  ## source     : memory ## names      : layer  ## values     : 1, 1  (min, max) ##  ##  ## [[2]] ## class      : RasterLayer  ## dimensions : 2, 2, 4  (nrow, ncol, ncell) ## resolution : 180, 90  (x, y) ## extent     : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) ## crs        : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs  ## source     : memory ## names      : layer  ## values     : 1, 1  (min, max) ##  ##  ## [[3]] ## class      : RasterLayer  ## dimensions : 2, 2, 4  (nrow, ncol, ncell) ## resolution : 180, 90  (x, y) ## extent     : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) ## crs        : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs  ## source     : memory ## names      : layer  ## values     : 1, 1  (min, max)

title: Using `nybem`
code: # Calculate HSI for single numeric site observations hsi_fresh.tid_obs_1 <- nybem::HSIcalc(si_list = siv_fresh.tid_obs_1) hsi_fresh.tid_obs_1 ## [1] 1 # Calculate HSI for raster site observations hsi_fresh.tid_obs_2 <- nybem::HSIcalc(si_list = siv_fresh.tid_obs_2) hsi_fresh.tid_obs_2 ## class      : RasterLayer  ## dimensions : 2, 2, 4  (nrow, ncol, ncell) ## resolution : 180, 90  (x, y) ## extent     : -180, 180, -90, 90  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) ## crs        : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs  ## source     : memory ## names      : layer  ## values     : 1, 1  (min, max)

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Michael.P.Dougherty@usace.army.mil. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: NY Bight Ecological Model
text: R package performing coastal habitat modeling.

title: NY Bight Ecological Model
text: package contains collection functions modeling coastal habitat ongoing USACE studies New Jersey Back Bays (NJBB) NY/NJ Harbor Tributaries Study (HATS).

title: NY Bight Ecological Model
text: Funding development maintenance nybem provided following US Army Corps Engineers (USACE) programs: NY/NJ Harbor Tributaries Study (HATS) New Jersey Back Bays (NJBB)

title: Calculate Habitat Suitability Index (HSI) — HSIcalc
text: Calculates habitat suitability index input suitability indices using specified method.

title: Calculate Habitat Suitability Index (HSI) — HSIcalc
text: si_list list; list suitability indices. method character; method calculating suitability index. Must one "mean",

title: Calculate Habitat Suitability Index (HSI) — HSIcalc
text: HSI object matching data format input suitability indices.

title: Calculate Habitat Suitability Index (HSI) — HSIcalc
code: # Build manual model # Number of trees > 51cm diameter per 0.4 ha plot tree.num     <- c(0, 2, 4, NA)              # parameter breakpoints tree.num.SIV <- c(0.1, 1, 1, NA)            # parameter suitability indices tree_num <- data.frame(tree.num, tree.num.SIV)  # Mean diameter of overstory trees avg.dbh      <- c(0, 5, 20, NA)             # parameter breakpoints avg.dbh.SIV  <- c(0, 0, 1, NA)              # parameter suitability indices tree_diameter <- data.frame(avg.dbh, avg.dbh.SIV)  # Percent canopy cover of overstory trees can.cov      <- c(0, 20, 60, 100)           # parameter breakpoints can.cov.SIV  <- c(0, 0, 1, 1)               # parameter suitability indices canopy_cov <- data.frame(can.cov, can.cov.SIV)  barredowl <- data.frame(tree_num, tree_diameter, canopy_cov)  bo_test1 <- list(2, 5, 20)  # Barredowl si values bo_si_1 <- nybem::SIcalc(barredowl, bo_test1)  # Calculate HSI bo_hsi <- HSIcalc(si_list = bo_si_1)

what: Plots habitat suitability index curves — HSIplotter
title: Plots habitat suitability index curves — HSIplotter
text: Plots habitat suitability index curves metrics model.

title: Plots habitat suitability index curves — HSIplotter
code: HSIplotter(SI, xlab = NA, ylab = NA, ncol = 2)

title: Plots habitat suitability index curves — HSIplotter
text: SI data frame; data frame suitability curves ordered parameter breakpoints associated suitability indices parameter appropriate column names. xlab character; vector x-axis label values SI. Defaults SI variable name. ylab character; vector y-axis label values SI. Defaults "Suitability Index". ncol numeric; Number columns plot.

title: Plots habitat suitability index curves — HSIplotter
text: multipanel figure displaying suitability curves.

title: Plots habitat suitability index curves — HSIplotter
text: US Fish Wildlife Service. (1980). Habitat basis environmental assessment. Ecological Services Manual, 101. US Fish Wildlife Service. (1980). Habitat Evaluation Procedures (HEP). Ecological Services Manual, 102. US Fish Wildlife Service. (1981). Standards Development Habitat Suitability Index Models. Ecological Services Manual, 103.

title: Plots habitat suitability index curves — HSIplotter
code: # Get barredowl HSI model record from the `ecorest`package (example of # continuous metrics) barredowl_ecorest <- ecorest::HSImodels$barredowl  # Create the plot HSIplotter(barredowl_ecorest)   # Get americancoot HSI model record from the `ecorest`package (example of # continuous and categorical metrics) americancoot_ecorest <- ecorest::HSImodels$americancoot  # Create the plot HSIplotter(americancoot_ecorest)

title: NYBEM Submodels — nybem_submodels
text: list submodels used NYBEM feasibility study.

title: NYBEM Submodels — nybem_submodels
text: list following named submodels: NYBEM.fresh.tid - Freshwater, Tidal Zone model. NYBEM.fresh.tid_labels - Freshwater, Tidal Zone labels. NYBEM.est.int - Estuarine, Intertidal Zone model. NYBEM.est.int_labels - Estuarine, Intertidal Zone labels. NYBEM.est.sub.hard - Estuarine, Subtidal Zone, Hard Bottom model. NYBEM.est.sub.hard_labels - Estuarine, Subtidal Zone, Hard Bottom labels. NYBEM.est.sub.soft.sav - Estuarine, Subtidal Zone, Soft Bottom, Submersed Aquatic Vegetation model. NYBEM.est.sub.soft.sav_labels - Estuarine, Subtidal Zone, Soft Bottom, Submersed Aquatic Vegetation labels. NYBEM.est.sub.soft.clam - Estuarine, Subtidal Zone, Soft Bottom, Hard Clam model. NYBEM.est.sub.soft.clam_labels - Estuarine, Subtidal Zone, Soft Bottom, Hard Clam labels. NYBEM.mar.int - Marine, Intertidal Zone model. NYBEM.mar.int_labels - Marine, Intertidal Zone labels. NYBEM.mar.sub - Marine, Subtidal Zone model. NYBEM.mar.sub_labels - Marine, Subtidal Zone labels. NYBEM.mar.deep - Marine, Deepwater Zone model. NYBEM.mar.deep_labels - Marine, Deepwater Zone labels.

title: Create a Tidal Zone Raster — set_tidal_zone
text: tidal zone categorical RasterLayer : Deep Subtidal Intertidal Upland

title: Create a Tidal Zone Raster — set_tidal_zone
text: z-values input rasters must expressed vertical datum (.e., National Tidal Datum Epoch, NAVD88).

title: Calculate Suitability Indices — SIcalc
text: SIcalc computes suitability indices given set suitability curves project-specific inputs. Suitability indices may computed based either linear interpolation (continuous variables) lookup method (categorical variables).

title: Calculate Suitability Indices — SIcalc
text: SI data frame matrix; matrix suitability curves ordered parameter breakpoints associated suitability indices parameter. input_proj list; list numeric categorical vectors application-specific input parameters associated suitability curve data SI.

title: Calculate Suitability Indices — SIcalc
text: vector suitability index values match given user inputs. Values returned equal extreme range inputs outside model range.

title: Calculate Suitability Indices — SIcalc
text: SI parameter must contain set column pairs. column pairs consist

title: Calculate Suitability Indices — SIcalc
text: US Fish Wildlife Service. (1980). Habitat basis environmental assessment. Ecological Services Manual, 101. US Fish Wildlife Service. (1980). Habitat Evaluation Procedures (HEP). Ecological Services Manual, 102. US Fish Wildlife Service. (1981). Standards Development Habitat Suitability Index Models. Ecological Services Manual, 103.

title: Calculate Suitability Indices — SIcalc
code: # Build manual model # Number of trees > 51cm diameter per 0.4 ha plot tree.num     <- c(0, 2, 4, NA)              # parameter breakpoints tree.num.SIV <- c(0.1, 1, 1, NA)            # parameter suitability indices tree_num <- data.frame(tree.num, tree.num.SIV)  # Mean diameter of overstory trees avg.dbh      <- c(0, 5, 20, NA)             # parameter breakpoints avg.dbh.SIV  <- c(0, 0, 1, NA)              # parameter suitability indices tree_diameter <- data.frame(avg.dbh, avg.dbh.SIV)  # Percent canopy cover of overstory trees can.cov      <- c(0, 20, 60, 100)           # parameter breakpoints can.cov.SIV  <- c(0, 0, 1, 1)               # parameter suitability indices canopy_cov <- data.frame(can.cov, can.cov.SIV)  barredowl <- data.frame(tree_num, tree_diameter, canopy_cov)  bo_test1 <- list(2, 5, 20)  # Barredowl si values bo_si_1 <- nybem::SIcalc(barredowl, bo_test1)

title: nybem v0.1.4 (Release date: 2022-05-05)
text: Added package documentation preparation USACE ECO-PCX model review. Added nybem_submodels containing ecological models New Jersey Back Bay study.
